data.meanings: absent/remote/hidden/concealed, absent from the range or beyond the reach of perception by sense or of mental perception, unseen/invisible.
data.sentence: The word بِالْغَيْبِ comes from the root غ ي ب and is associated with the meanings: absent/remote/hidden/concealed, absent from the range or beyond the reach of perception by sense or of mental perception, unseen/invisible.

data.meanings: To be hard, become hard, be grievous, grow up, be great. Kabira/Yakburu: To be exceed anyone in age, become stout and tall, grow big, become great, illustrious, become momentous (affair).
data.sentence: The word كَبِيرٌ comes from the root ك ب ر and is associated with the meanings: To be hard, become hard, be grievous, grow up, be great. Kabira/Yakburu: To be exceed anyone in age, become stout and tall, grow big, become great, illustrious, become momentous (affair).

data.meanings: protect, cover over, shield, forgive, pardon.
data.sentence: The word مَغْفِرَةٌ comes from the root غ ف ر and is associated with the meanings: protect, cover over, shield, forgive, pardon.

data.meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.
data.sentence: The word رَبَّهُمْ comes from the root ر ب ب and is associated with the meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.

data.meanings: To fear or dread, to fear with reverence/veneration/honour/awe, to hope, to know a thing, frighten or make to fear/dread, be cautious or wary.
data.sentence: The word يَخْشَوْنَ comes from the root خ ش ي and is associated with the meanings: To fear or dread, to fear with reverence/veneration/honour/awe, to hope, to know a thing, frighten or make to fear/dread, be cautious or wary.
The word وَأَجْرٌ comes from the root ا ج ر and is associated with the meanings: recompense/compensation/reward, hire/pay/wage for service, profit
